channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - HP Hero
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: The drone strike in Afghanistan killed the planner, initial indications show, according to US Central Command
item.description: The US has conducted an airstrike against an ISIS-K planner, a spokesman for US Central Command said in a statement Friday.

item.title: US Embassy in Kabul again warns US citizens to leave airport gates 'immediately'
Analysis: Blast raises questions about Biden's leadership
item.description: America's longest war ending as it began, with the nation mourning the dead of a terrorist attack and an outraged President vowing to hunt down the culprits in Afghanistan.

item.title: Hear statement from family of Marine killed in Kabul
item.description: US Marine Rylee McCollum, 20, has been identified as one of the US service members killed in the terror attack at the Kabul airport. CNN's Oren Liebermann reads a statement from his family.

item.title: A soon-to-be father, a beloved brother and a state champion among US service members killed in Kabul attack
item.description: Thirteen US service members were killed and 18 were injured in an attack outside Kabul's airport on Thursday, as the US and other Western countries raced to evacuate their citizens and allies out of Afghanistan.

item.title: Fareed Zakaria's prediction of what's to come in Afghanistan
item.description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria explains how the rivalry between the Taliban and ISIS-K could lead to the beginning of another Afghan civil war.

item.title: Witness describes carnage of Kabul airport attack
This is how likely you are to get Covid if you're vaccinated
item.description: • Judge rules against Florida governor's ban on mask mandates in schools • Mississippi hospitals are overrun with Covid-19 patients • Opinion: Make the unvaccinated pay out for their deadly decisions

item.title: Coffee may reduce risk of death from stroke and heart disease
Board recommends parole for RFK assassin Sirhan Sirhan on 16th attempt
item.description: • Photos: Kennedy family tragedies

item.title: Two of RFK's sons offer support for parole for Sirhan Sirhan
item.description: Sirhan Sirhan, the man convicted of assassinating Sen. Robert F. Kennedy in 1968, was recommended for parole. After spending 53 year in prison, the 77-year-old inmate's fate now rests in the hands of California Gov. Gavin Newsom. CNN's Natasha Chen reports two of Kennedy's surviving sons offered their support for parole during Sirhan's 16th appearance before the parole board.

item.title: Analysis: Stephen Breyer just made Democrats' Friday
item.description: It's been a brutal week for President Joe Biden -- and, as a result, for Democrats more generally.

item.title: Biden announces pay raise plan for federal employees
item.description: President Joe Biden on Friday formally announced his plan to raise the wages of federal workers, saying civilian federal employees will see an overall average increase of 2.7% in 2022.

item.title: Angry parents chase down governor after school meeting
item.description: A meeting that included discussion about Connecticut's school mask mandate got heated as angry parents followed Gov. Ned Lamont out of the building and shouted at him.

item.title: Unvaccinated, unmasked teacher infected students in class with Covid, CDC reports
item.description: An unvaccinated elementary school teacher who took off their mask to read to students ended up infecting more than half of them last May -- and they went on to infect other students, family members and community members, California public health officials reported Friday.

item.title: Renewed fears of political violence grip Capitol Hill ahead of right-wing rally
item.description: Lawmakers and law enforcement officials are growing concerned about the possibility of violence and unrest on Capitol Hill as two key dates approach next month: a right-wing rally in support of the jailed January 6 rioters and the 20th anniversary of 9/11.

item.title: Navy helicopter crash-lands in Mexico
item.description: Several people were injured as a navy helicopter, en-route to areas hit by Hurricane Grace, crashed in Agua Blanca, Mexico, on August 25.

item.title: Flying on Southwest has been awful. The company has a fix
item.description: This summer, flying Southwest Airlines has been a toxic mix of canceled flights, long delays and disgruntled pilots and flight attendants. Apologizing to its passengers for its bad service, the company is promising to fix the problem by cutting the number of flights it operates this fall.

item.title: Here's what renters can expect after the end of the federal eviction ban
item.description: The federal eviction ban, which protected millions of struggling renters while frustrating landlords across the country, has ended for the second time in just four weeks.

item.title: See massive jellyfish swarm wash up on beach
item.description: Jellyfish gather along the coast every year to feed and breed, but higher water temperatures have created ideal conditions for their numbers to boom.

item.title: Dwayne Johnson seems to have a doppelgänger in Alabama
item.description: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has a has a look-alike.

item.title: F-bombs and hate mail: Restaurants take heat when they ask for proof of vaccination
item.description: When Cowbell, a comfort food restaurant in New Orleans, started requiring proof of vaccination for indoor dining, some customers were less than thrilled.

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' breaks barriers with same-sex partnership
item.description: Jojo Siwa and Suni Lee join the new season of 'Dancing with the Stars,' with Jojo Siwa being the first person to compete with a same-sex partner. HLN's Melissa Knowles reports.

item.title: New Zealand is one of the last countries sticking to a zero Covid strategy
item.description: When New Zealand went into lockdown last week over a single Delta case, critics were quick to mock the country's risk-averse approach.

item.title: This former ICU nurse makes $200k a month on OnlyFans
item.description: OnlyFans reversed its decision to ban sexually explicit content on the platform, after backlash from creators like Allie Rae who earn a living on the site.

item.title: Parts of Gulf Coast ordered to evacuate. Hurricane Ida expected to be Category 4 storm when it hits
item.description: Ida became a hurricane Friday afternoon as it swept toward western Cuba -- and it's expected to strengthen into a major hurricane as it approaches the US Gulf Coast this weekend, putting states from Louisiana to Florida on alert for fierce destruction.

item.title: New Orleans mayor says there's not enough time to order new mandatory evacuations ahead of Hurricane Ida
item.description: Almost 16 years to the date after Hurricane Katrina overwhelmed the city's flood protection system, New Orleans is bracing for another potentially dangerous storm.

item.title: Track the storm here
Dream vacation spot has two major problems: Debt and climate crisis
item.description: Former Maldives President Mohamed Nasheed, the Climate Vulnerable Forum's Ambassador for Ambition, discusses the climate report. Nasheed advocates for wealthy nations paying to help vulnerable countries deal with the impact of climate change.

item.title: Sign up for email weather alerts
After decades of near-silence from the CDC on guns, the agency's director is speaking up
item.description: For the first time in decades, the director of the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention -- the nation's top public health agency -- is speaking out forcefully about gun violence in America, calling it a "serious public health threat."

item.title: Opinion: What lessons can Canada teach America?
item.description: As Americans across the country celebrated the nation's independence and its freedom from the apparent worst of the coronavirus pandemic, an epidemic of a different kind remained on familiar display: the surge in shootings.

item.title: Opinion: An epidemic within the pandemic
item.description: In recent months, Americans have received a string of horrific reminders that even as Covid deaths fall, one of our nation's deadliest public health emergencies rages on: gun violence.

item.title: Covid-19 hospitalization risk doubles with Delta variant, study suggests
Eating a hot dog could take 36 minutes off your life, study says
item.description: You may want to skip the toppings on your next hot dog, or skip it altogether: Health researchers at the University of Michigan have found that eating a single hot dog could take 36 minutes off your life.

item.title: See this Ohio zoo's name reveal for its new baby elephant
item.description: The Columbus Zoo had a name reveal celebration for it's 9-week old Asian elephant calf.

item.title: Seaglider: This boat-plane hybrid could transform inter-city commutes
item.description: At a time when transportation infrastructure projects seem to be taking center stage in US public debate, a Boston-based start-up backed by some of Silicon Valley's most prominent investors wants to turn the sea lanes along the country's east and west coasts into high-speed transit corridors.

item.title: 'No one has money.' Under Taliban, Afghanistan's banks are imploding
item.description: The Taliban's rule of Afghanistan faces an imminent threat: The war-torn nation's banking system is on the verge of collapse.

item.title: China blasts '996' excessive work culture
item.description: China is putting companies that overwork their employees on notice.

item.title: Wendy's is upgrading its french fries
item.description: Few things in life are worse than a soggy french fry. Wendy's says it has a solution.

item.title: Kanye West's Yeezy jacket is a huge hit for Gap
item.description: The Gap's remarkable turnaround under CEO Sonia Syngal is continuing, thanks in part to Kanye West, TikTok and Simone Biles.

item.title: REI is having a massive Labor Day sale — here's what to shop
32 Nordstrom fashion picks to refresh your wardrobe for fall
Google's Pixel Buds A-Series earbuds are seriously impressive for $99
When does a home equity loan make sense? Here's everything to know
We tested 14 top-rated rain jackets: Only 1 stood out
We tried the Moon Pod to see if it's actually worth the hype
Is Outer outdoor furniture worth the splurge? Yes.
We tested out 13 cooling fans and there were 4 clear winners
20 products under $20 to help organize your closet
Dyson, Apple, REI and more: The best sales to shop this weekend
We tested water bottles for months. Only two stood out
The ultimate guide to facial serums, according to beauty experts
Make the unvaccinated pay out
item.description: It's time to stop forcing the vaccinated majority of Americans to accommodate those who refuse to take this simple step -- especially now that at least one Covid-19 vaccine has been fully approved.

item.title: Trump's rally script fell apart
item.description: Starting well before he ever got elected, former President Donald Trump had a talent for making his rallygoers boo. Just mentioning Hillary Clinton or CNN (or, near the end of his presidency, Fox News) would trigger a paroxysm of jeering from his supporters, who knew the role they played in punctuating his performances and happily did their part.

item.title: Ilhan Omar: Open arms to refugees
item.description: As I heard the news out of Afghanistan—the families scrambling to get on American planes, or the thousands of requests for assistance pouring into my office—I was taken instantly back to my childhood. I remembered sitting in a refugee camp in Kenya when I was about 10 years old and overhearing my father and grandfather discuss how we were going to get out. "Only in America can you ultimately become an American," my grandfather said. "Everywhere else we will always feel like a guest."

item.title: America's awful options in Afghanistan
item.description: The blasts that killed 13 US service members and left scores of people dead and wounded near the gates of the Kabul airport serve as a powerful reminder of the threats in Afghanistan and the challenges that lie ahead as America tries to disengage. While President Joe Biden has committed to ending the 20-year military campaign in Afghanistan -- triggered by the Taliban's refusal to hand over al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden following the 9/11 terrorist attacks -- the US will continue to face tough choices there.

item.title: Children of MLK and LBJ speak out
item.description: In 1845 James Russell Lowell, the well-known Harvard Law School graduate and abolitionist, wrote words that continue to ring in our hearts over 175 years later. They were written to address national debate over slavery and the impending war with Mexico -- and they are as relevant today as ever.

item.title: The end of fandom may be upon us
item.description: Louis C.K. recently kicked off a new standup tour with a sold-out pair of shows in New York. Against the backdrop of a giant "Sorry" sign, he delivered a set that -- according to a reporter who was there -- included gags about pedophilia, his penis, "gay jokes, Jew jokes, cancer jokes, a heavy helping of transgender jokes, and a sprinkling of additional race jokes."

item.title: Stop asking if 'The Chair' is realistic
item.description: A few classroom moments remain with me from more than 16 years of teaching literature. One proved memorable not because it was singular but because it was typical. We were discussing "Iola Leroy," an 1892 novel by Frances E. W. Harper -- one of the first novels published by an African American woman -- whose female protagonist is mixed-race but looks white.

item.title: Naomi Osaka's vital lesson
item.description: It's the middle of my much-needed vacation, and just under a month after Naomi Osaka shocked the tennis world by pulling out of the French Open, and I am, inexplicably, emailing with her about NFTs -- and mental health.

item.title: Total Recall: California's Political Circus
Dr. Leana Wen says there is one last best hope to get people vaccinated
Biden's Afghanistan deadline nears
It's still not too late. Refinance today.
$39* & up: Nationwide Fall Fare Sale (One Way)
6 reasons this is the best cash back card of 2021
Gunmen in Nigeria free scores of young schoolchildren abducted three months ago
item.description: Scores of schoolchildren who were abducted at gunpoint at a school in Nigeria's north-central Niger State have been freed and handed over to their families, a government spokesperson told CNN Friday.

item.title: Thai police questioned after video emerges of drug suspect being tortured and killed
item.description: Two Thai police officers suspected of being involved in torturing to death a man charged with drug offenses gave themselves up for questioning on Thursday after a video of the incident went viral in a case likely to test the resolve of the judicial system.
